results.title: At the Heart of the Documents Case: Trump’s Attachment to His Boxes
results.abstract: The former president has long stowed papers and odds and ends in cartons that he liked to keep close. His aides have called it the “beautiful mind” material.

results.title: Surfside Condo’s Pool Deck Had ‘Severe Strength Deficiency,’ Investigators Say
results.abstract: Federal investigators released preliminary findings on the 13-story tower’s collapse in Florida but say more work is needed to determine what led to 98 deaths.
org_facet: National Institute of Standards and Technology

media.caption: Concerns about the pool deck have surfaced repeatedly since the June 2021 collapse at Champlain Towers South that left 98 people dead.

results.title: As Ties to China Turn Toxic, Even Chinese Companies Are Breaking Them
results.abstract: Companies are moving headquarters and factories outside the country and cleaving off their Chinese businesses. It’s not clear the strategy will work.
geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

results.title: Jack Johnson’s Oahu
results.abstract: The Hawaii-born singer-songwriter and activist recommends some places he loves on the island he still calls home. And yes, surfing and music are involved.

media.caption: Waimea Valley was neglected for decades and is now a nonprofit botanical garden and preservation area dedicated to Hawaiian history and farming.
media.copyright: Michelle Mishina Kunz for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Shopping Centers and Malls;Real Estate (Commercial);Shopping and Retail;Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);CUSHMAN & WAKEFIELD INC;Westfield Corp;San Francisco (Calif)
results.byline: By Jordyn Holman and Thomas Fuller
results.title: Westfield Gives Up San Francisco Mall, Signaling More Pain Ahead
results.abstract: Retailers have been fleeing the city’s downtown, and some analysts say there may be more to come. It’s an issue facing various downtowns around the United States.

media.caption: Westfield, which has owned the downtown San Francisco Centre mall since 2002, said this week that it was handing it back to its lender. The mall is expected to be 45 percent empty when Nordstrom departs this summer.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Women and Girls;Discrimination;Ministers (Protestant);Baptist Churches;Evangelical Movement;Barnes Popham, Linda;Warren, Rick;Southern Baptist Convention;Fern Creek Baptist Church (Louisville, Ky);Saddleback Church;New Orleans (La);Louisville (Ky)
results.byline: By Ruth Graham and Elizabeth Dias
results.title: Southern Baptists Vote to Further Expand Restrictions on Women as Leaders
results.abstract: Delegates at the denomination’s convention approved a stricter ban on female pastors and rejected the appeals of two churches led by women to remain in the denomination.

media.caption: Linda Barnes Popham, the pastor of Fern Creek Baptist Church, held up a Bible as she appealed the Southern Baptist Convention’s decision to expel her church from the denomination.
media.copyright: Christiana Botic for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Obesity;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Psychology and Psychologists;United States
results.title: New Obesity Drugs Come With a Side Effect of Shaming
results.abstract: Wegovy and other drugs expose a social tension between a quest to medicate illness and a stigmatizing belief that obese people lack sufficient willpower to lose weight.

media.caption: Katarra Ewing of Detroit will readily tell anyone who asks that she takes Wegovy, which helped her lose 90 pounds. But she said some longtime friends fell away after she lost weight.
media.copyright: Cydni Elledge for The New York Times

results.title: Oregon Town’s Marijuana Boom Yields Envy in Idaho
results.abstract: Tax revenue has surged since cannabis stores opened in Ontario, Ore., fueling a push in neighboring Idaho to legalize sales and get in on the action.

results.title: Two Lifelong Floridians Bolted for Los Angeles, but What Could They Afford?
results.abstract: A couple of empty nesters, tired of the humidity and politics in the Sunshine State, headed west to be closer to their children. Which L.A. neighborhood would be right for their retirement years?

media.caption: Alice Vickers and John Davis in Los Angeles, where they recently bought a house after living most of their lives in Florida. Scouring the city was a daunting process, Ms. Vickers said: “We had no idea of any parts of it and where we would want to live.”

results.title: Google Might Owe You Money. Here’s How to Get It.
